metadata.synopsis: After the party, this companion is still trying to come down from all the energy, and with a good enough bond it is possible for the player avatar to flirt and unlock a romance option. Gale has been drinking wine, but is not drunk. The wine is mentioned in a few spots, but it shouldn't influence his diction.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Recruit Gale to your partyRecon: oe qnight NIGHT_GoblinHunt_TieflingCelebration_1ad8c357-2695-4d5c-b5f9-8b8c07803121Go to camp and chat with him

0.speaker: Gale
0.text: Enjoy the night. It seems to me full of opportunities.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale looks at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfeltNodeContext: You look at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfelt.

46.speaker: Gale
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale looks at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfeltNodeContext: You look at the player with a big smile and the words are warm and heartfelt.

108.speaker: Player
108.context: NodeContext: You were about to say "It would entail..." but you stop yourself.

17.speaker: Player
17.context: NodeContext: You were about to say "It would entail..." but you stop yourself.

96.speaker: Gale
96.text: I'm glad you sought me out. Amid all this merriment I wasn't sure we'd have a chance to speak this evening.

94.speaker: Player
94.context: NodeContext: You were about to say "It would entail..." but you stop yourself.

25.speaker: Gale
25.text: Come now! This is a night for celebration, not suspicion.
25.context: NodeContext: You were about to say "It would entail..." but you stop yourself.

100.speaker: Gale
100.text: I thank you for seeking me out. Amidst all this merriment I wasn't sure we'd have a chance to speak this evening.
100.context: NodeContext: You were about to say "It would entail..." but you stop yourself.

2.speaker: Gale
2.text: I wasn't sure we'd have a chance to make merry, just the two of us.
2.context: NodeContext: You were about to say "It would entail..." but you stop yourself.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I think that's the wine talking.
95.context: NodeContext: You were about to say "It would entail..." but you stop yourself.

52.speaker: Gale
52.text: As they say in Waterdeep: in wine there is truth.

5.speaker: Gale
5.text: That's usually followed by: in water there is good sense.

44.speaker: Gale
44.text: Good sense will have to wait 'til the morrow.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Make merry, just the two of us. What would that entail?
97.context: NodeContext: You were about to say "It would entail..." but you stop yourself.

88.speaker: Gale
88.text: That, my friend, must remain a secret. For now. Or rather: for as long as you've eyes only for someone else among our troupe.
88.context: NodeContext: You were about to say "It would entail..." but you stop yourself.

45.speaker: Gale
45.text: I know there are many things about me that remain shrouded in mystery. You've been very patient with me, and I appreciate that.

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: You've given me powerful magic to consume when I needed it most.

24.speaker: Gale
24.text: You've brought me back from the grey shores of death.

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: You know of my condition, and you know about my unfortunate efforts to win Mystra's favour, but those are but the broad strokes.

39.speaker: Gale
39.text: You know of my condition and its challenges, but those are but the broad strokes.

106.speaker: Gale
106.text: The time has come to paint you the true picture.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: I have to admit I'm curious.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I've waited long enough, haven't I?

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: I can only hope my tale will live up to your expectations.

75.speaker: Gale
75.text: Tonight, of course, we celebrate, and I won't keep you any longer. Tomorrow night though, you're in for quite the bedtime story.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: What makes you think I still care?

41.speaker: Gale
41.text: Curiosity is a trait we all share.

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: I was given powerful magic to consume when I needed it most.

10.speaker: Gale
10.context: NodeContext: You were about to say "It would entail..." but you stop yourself.

74.speaker: Gale
74.text: Actually, on second thought I can't think of it entailing anything particularly enticing at all.

61.speaker: Gale
61.text: Forgive me, I seem to be of two minds and two moods. We'll blame the wine and leave it at that.

60.speaker: Gale
60.text: We shared a romantic moment of the mind while cloaked in the Weave, didn't we?

76.speaker: Gale
76.text: And I seem to recall a fond allusion to that moment afterwards.

72.speaker: Gale
72.text: Perhaps that's a moment we ought to further explore.

92.speaker: Gale
92.text: We had a moment, you and I, a moment in which we expressed the possibility of becoming more than friends.

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: Tonight seems perfectly suited for such endeavours.

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: Allow me to make the following proposition:

67.speaker: Gale
67.text: There's a book that circulates in Amn, detailing the first thousand nights of a newlywed king and queen.

84.speaker: Gale
84.text: They turned everything they did into an art. The art of conversation. The art of taste, time honoured and newly acquired.

4.speaker: Gale
4.text: The art of the body. The exploration and acceptance of the self and the other. The art of the night itself.

38.speaker: Gale
38.text: I say we take a page from their book.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Leave it to you to woo someone with a book.

73.speaker: Gale
73.text: Forget the book then. Let's be blank slates on blank sheets, delightfully new.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: You're remarkably upfront about your intentions.

57.speaker: Gale
57.text: I'm many things, but coy's not one of them.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I'll remind you we're newly acquainted, not newlyweds.

13.speaker: Gale
13.text: Then we'll start writing the prequel.

93.speaker: Gale
93.text: That's because I'm full of delights.

6.speaker: Gale
6.text: We'll let the night run its course. And when everything is quieting down, safe in the arms of sleep, I'll come by to find safety in yours.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I'm afraid I have to decline.

16.speaker: Gale
16.text: Too bad. One should never be afraid to live life to the fullest.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I'm not sure you're the one I want.

62.speaker: Gale
62.text: That's because you've yet to find out what you're missing.

113.speaker: Gale
113.text: Doubt is a spoilsport. Cast it aside.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: You're right. I'd like to spend the night with you.

107.speaker: Gale
107.text: A match made... not quite in heaven, but close enough.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Let me stop you right there. That's not something I'm interested in.

30.speaker: Gale
30.text: Merely to share a glass of wine I suppose; to toast to victory and to offer you an invitation.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Actually I think I'll go mix and mingle.

35.speaker: Gale
35.text: More's the pity you've already found someone else to make merry with, just the two of you.

50.speaker: Gale
50.text: He has a certain charm about him, Astarion. Then again, so does a tiger when it purrs.

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: You might be in for an adventure with Karlach. More than you bargained for - with a bit of luck.

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: Or perhaps more than you bargained for - full stop.

65.speaker: Gale
65.text: Lae'zel. Blade like a razor, wit like a razor, tongue like a razor.

89.speaker: Gale
89.text: I do hope you know what you're doing.

91.speaker: Gale
91.text: There's something... unspeakable about Shadowheart. But I mean that in a good way. She seems to me like a bud on the cusp of bursting into a rose.

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: Far be it from me of course, to question your tastes.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: And yet you question them nonetheless.

51.speaker: Gale
51.text: Caught on to that, did you? Might be the wine talking.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Do I detect a hint of jealousy?

1.speaker: Gale
1.text: Jealousy is in the eye of the beholder. Or something along those lines, the wine might be befuddling me a smidge.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Didn't peg you for a sore loser, Gale.

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: Am I? Perhaps I am. Or perhaps I need another glass of wine.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Actually, I may just want to spend the night with you instead of Astarion.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Actually, I may just want to spend the night with you instead of Karlach.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Actually, I may just want to spend the night with you instead of Lae'zel.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Actually, I may just want to spend the night with you instead of Shadowheart.

80.speaker: Gale
80.text: You're all too quick to abandon the one you promised yourself to. That is not a quality I admire.

31.speaker: Gale
31.text: No, I was glad you sought me out for an entirely different reason:

15.speaker: Gale
15.text: I'm sorry, but surely we're friends, allies, the best of companions, but... no more than that.

82.speaker: Gale
82.text: No, I was glad you sought me out for an entirely different reason: to toast to victory and to offer you an invitation.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Actually, I may just want to spend the night with you instead of Wyll.

111.speaker: Gale
111.text: Wyll's a good man. He may actually be a tried-and-true storybook hero.

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: Then again he's so full of himself it's a small miracle he hasn't resorted to self-cannibalism yet.

81.speaker: Gale
81.text: I've said enough. Let silence do the talking.

101.speaker: Gale
101.text: There's promise in patience, I assure you. Let the night run its course so that we can run ours as well.
